instructionMessage: Let's start building your salary report with information about your current job. All the information you share with us will be kept strictly confidential and will not be shared with any third party.
mostRelevantSkills: Most Relevant Skills To Your Job (from 1 to 50)
noticeLine: Remember: the more specific your answers are the more accurate your salary report will be. Any information you share with us will be kept confidential.
mostRelevantSkills.placeholder: Ex: Agile, Git or Web Service
minimiseContent: Annual salary increases stand between 2% - 5%, while a promotion or a new job might get you a salary raise between 10% - 20%...
thanksForShare.headline.under50percent: Your Salary is at the bottom of the scale, do you deserve a pay raise?
thanksForShare.headline.under70percent: Your Salary is in the middle of the scale, would you consider better paid jobs?
thanksForShare.headline.under100percent: Congratulations, your Salary is at the top of the scale, is time for getting a promotion?
thanksForShare.item1.headline: 1 - Read Your Salary Report
thanksForShare.item1.content: This Salary Survey help you compare with people who do the same job at a similar company, have similar experience and live where you do. In general if your earnings fall below the 50% you probably want to start thinking about asking for a raise or looking for a new job.
thanksForShare.item2.headline: 2 - Strategize
thanksForShare.item2.content: Salary negotiation is always challenging, keep it professional, friendly, data driven and timely. Leverage your skills and experience to justify your salary raise request.
thanksForShare.item3.headline: 3 - Negotiate
thanksForShare.item3.content: Be ambitious but realistic, salary increases vary depends on industry but average stands between 2% to 5%, while a promotion or a new job might get you a salary increase between 10% to 20%.

contestDescription1: This year we are holding an amazing big contest for all IT developers and those who are interested in implementing an application. Our contest is continuously running through 4 months from 18 Jun 2015 to 14 Sep 2015 with the following timeline. NOW, we are open for submissions and welcome all guys who have a burning passion in building a successful application to join the contest. So, are you ready to go?
contestDescription2: In this first phase, between 18 Jun and 17 Jul 2015, your first mission is figuring out a challenge to get instructions to join a $2,000 contest! Your challenge is to read in a string of Braille characters (using standard English Braille defined here) and print off the word in standard English letters.
contestDescription3: The input will consistent of an array of 2x3 Braille characters, characters used for Blind people. A lowered bump is a dot character '.', while a raised bump is an upper-case 'O' character.
nowYourTurn: Now is your turn: Print the transcribed Braille below to know HOW TO PARTICIPATE IN A $2,000 CONTEST
weFindNoDataWithParam: We find no data related to {{text}}
whileUpdateYourJobInfo: While we are improving, could you update your Expected Job Title, Job Level and Job Category to know how to get promoted? Or please leave us your email in below field.

companyAddress: 130 Suong Nguyet Anh Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
descriptionChallengePost: Build And Grow Your Developer Community Base With Online Contests.
subHeaderChallenge: Let's start building your challenge information.
challengeNameTip: Your Challenge Name appears in search results. It is a good idea to include a catchy name that attracts contestants, you could include keywords specific for this challenge.
challengeOverViewEX: Ex: App that uses Augmented Reality to help jobseekers to search for jobs in a more interactive way.  For this challenge, it is required to create a mobile app (iOS or Android) that will allow users to search for jobs by pointing their phone’s camera to a company logo or company building entrance.
challengeOverViewTip: Brief your contestants with a short and accurate description of the challenge and the overal goals.
businessRequirementsEX: Ex: The app will need to cover the following minimum requirements: User registration through Facebook or Linkedin; Create a database based on top employers; Job Search on different job sites; Job Alert subscription. Also,...
businessRequirementsTip: Describe the purpose of the challenge, what is the business issue to fix, the general approach and the use cases to resolve.
generalNotesEX: Ex: It is mandatory that the app is submitted to relevant app store and that it complies with the rules and terms and conditions of the app store.
generalNotesTip: Give additional context to contestants and add any additional instructions that help contestants to better understand your requirements.
technologiesEX: Ex: iOS, Android, Java, Augmented Reality
technologiesTip: Specify the main technology stack required for this contest. You can define up to 10 technologies.
documentsEX: Ex: UI Prototype (URL will be provided by email).
documentsTip: Paste the URLs with documents contestants might need. Typically, full requirements specification, UI specs and designs or any other document relevant to the contest.
deliverablesEX: Ex: Working App on iOS or Android submitted to app store. Source code and documentation must be provided by GitHub URL.
deliverablesTip: Clearly specify what deliverables and the format expected for this contest.
emailAddressReceive: Email address to receive applications (limited to 5): *
emailAddressReceiveTip: When user joins your contests, a notification will be sent to all emails in this list (up to 5 emails).
subHeaderDeadlines: Your Challenge has the following deadlines.
challengeStartTip: This is the date when the challenge starts and start accepting registrations. During this time Contest Owner promotes the contest and review the registrations received.
challengeRegisterTip: Typically between 2-4 weeks after the challenge start date. After this date, the contest is officially in-progress and contestants are working on the challenge. It is up to you to accept more registrations at this stage.
challengeSubmit: And Contestants Must Submit Final App By: *
challengeSubmitTip: Contest duration should not be longer than 8 weeks. This date officially ends the contest. All the contestants must submit their solutions by this date.
qualityIdeaTip: The merit of the solution to your challenge can be categorized by the degree to which it fulfills your expectations. Here there 4 categories, select the one that would meet your expectations best.
implementationIdeaEX: Ex: Includes how well the idea was executed by the developer
reviewStyleTip: Currently, the contest review is contest owner responsibility.
publishingContest: Before publishing the contest, define acceptance criteria and rewards.
rewardTheWinner: You will reward the winner(s) with:
firstRewardTip: This is the reward for the winner of the contest; it is important to consider the scope of work, difficulty, resources required in order to price a contest in order to attract the right talent.
secondRewardTip: You might consider to reward the second contestant, this can help you to increase the number and quality of participants in your contest.
thirdRewardTip: You might consider to reward the third contestant, this can help you to increase the number and quality of participants in your contest.
registerNumber: There are {{registerNumber}} registrants for this contest.
reward2LessThanReward1: 2nd Place Reward should be  not higher than the 1st Place Reward.
reward3LessThanReward2: 3rd Place Reward should be not higher than the 2nd Place Reward.
startDateWt4w: Start date should be within next 4 weeks.
registerDateGTStartDate: Register day should be ahead of Start day at least 1 day.
submitDateGTRegisterDate: Submit day should be ahead of Register day at least 1 day.
theSolutionAchievesTheStatedGoals: The solution achieves the stated goals
theSolutionIsPracticalAndReliable: The solution is practical and reliable
termsConditionsContent1: Contest Owner will compensate members in accordance with the payment structure of this challenge.
termsConditionsContent2:
The full amount payment will be made no later than 2-weeks the challenge closure date.
The code and intellectual property developed during the challenge by the winning contestant(s) will belong solely to Contest Owner.
termsConditionsTip: By publishing a contest on TechLooper, you agree with these Terms & Conditions.
listRequire1Item: This list requires at least one item.
limitItemWithParam: You can add up to {{number}} items. Remove one to add another.

contestValue3: Nurture your talent pool with best IT professionals.
desPostAChallenge: Build a compelling brand by nurturing a thriving community of software engineers around your organization.
signUpVNW: Haven't had an account yet? Sign up
subChallengeYourselfTagLine: Gain Experience. Be recognized. Get rewarded.
congratulationsForJoinContest: You have just enrolled to the challenge.
congratulationsForJoinProject: You have already applied to this job.
enableCookies: This website requires cookies to provide all of its features. So please enable cookies in your web browser to continue.
desPostAProject: Find IT professionals quick and easy.
desWorkDone: Describe the work to be done: *
desWorkDoneEx: Ex: Your responsibilities includes: Assist in design and development of large-scale iOS applications; Perform modifications and enhancements based on business needs; Develop clean, high-quality & reusable codes based on prog standards; Coordinate with Project Manager for requirements and expectations.
howWouldYouLikeToPay: How would you like to pay? *
desPostAProjectTip:
The more details, the better

Quality freelancers look for detailed descriptions. We suggest the following:

  • • A short 1-2 sentence job overview
  • • What you need the freelancer to do
  • • Key skills needed to do the job well
  • • What you think a successful engagement will look like for you as a client
  • • Why the right freelancer should be interested in the job
  • • Any questions or info you want the freelancer to include in their application
giveYourJobTitleTip:
What's in a name?

A lot, actually. A concise, yet specific job title will help attract qualified applicants. For instance:

  • • Writer Wanted for Travel Blog
  • • ActiveSync Integration for PHP
  • • Are You a Wordpress Wizard?
fixedPricePayByProject: Fixed price. Pay by the project.
exPaymentConfig: Ex: Hourly. Pay by the hour.
numberOfHiresTip: You want to hire one freelancer or more than one freelancer?
whatSkillsAreNeededTip:
List the skills you're looking for

Attract the most qualified candidates and make your job pop up in a search.
estimatedEndDateFromNow: Estimated End Date cannot be in the past.
requiredLargerZero: Number of freelancers to hire should be between 1 and 99.
numberFreelancerBW199: Number of freelancers to hire should be between 1 and 99.
hourlyRateGT0: Hourly Rate should be greater than 0.
findFreelancer: Find freelancer jobs quick and easy.
postedProjectSuccessful: You have posted this project successfully.
whyFreelancerHeader: Quickly Find Top Freelancers. Get Your Project Done.
whyFreelancerDescription: Start your jobs in hours. Get amazing results working with the best programmers, designers, and other top online professionals. Once posted your project requirements, get skilled freelancers contact details and interview your favorite ones.
whyFreelancerFeature1: Post your freelancers needs within minutes.
whyFreelancerFeature3: Work with real experts on the skills you need.
interactiveJobDescription: “ We are tapping into a larger community of developers that we could not reach before. We are creating a closer relationship with developer community that is helping us to speed up our innovation. ”
craftDescription: We can help you to decide the challenge and the format that might suit you best.
manageDescription: Our platform will help you to post challenges and manage contestants' registrations.
promoteDescription: We leverage our developer community to help you speak out your challenge.
projectValue1: Post your freelancer needs within minutes
projectValue3: Work with real experts on the skills you need
desPostFreelancerProject: Start your job in hours. Get amazing results working with the best programmers, designers, and other top online professionals.
whyChallengeHeader: Build Your Developer Community. Hire Better. Hire Faster.
whyChallengeSubHeader: Challenge and find the best of the best
whyChallengeDescription: Propose a software challenge and get involved UX Designers, Front-end developers, Product Managers, Data Scientists and/or Software Developers to participate. Our platform makes running software contests easy, beautiful, and secured.
whyChallengeFeature1: Nurture a talent pool with best IT professionals
whyChallengeFeature2: Build a compelling brand and be recognized for your drive to innovate
faceVietnamworksDescription: “ Given business requirements sometimes we need to scale our team cost-effectively. We hire freelancers to help us to develop and run specific campaigns and products, with most of them we still work today. ”

getStarted:
Let's get started!
First, tell us who you are.
techTalentContent1: I want to find quickly projects and build a rewarding business that I love.
techTalentContent2: I want to get rewarded and show off my coding passion and competence through challenges.

businessOwnerContent2: I want to post code challenge to attract talents better and faster.
itJobCornerContent1: Thousands of new jobs available from job sites.

whoJoinAndWhyNote: Write a brief description to let members know what to expect
whoJoinAndWhyEx: Ex: We are holding an online kick-off event on Thursday 23rd of July from 18:30-19:30 on Google Hangout. During this event we will talk about: TechLooper vision and features; Interactive Job Contest timeline and requirements; Usability test: 5 second test and click test (we recommend https://usabilityhub.com); VietnamWorks API; And we will go through all your questions. If you want to contact me, please write to code@vietnamworks.com. Looking forward to talk to you all!

challengeIdeaTips: This date officially ends the Idea phase of the contest. Contestants must propose their ideas to Contest Owner by this date. Once the Contest Owner approves the idea, contestant who proposed the idea will be selected to go to the next phase.
challengeUIUXTips: This date officially ends the UI/UX phase of the contest. Contestants must propose their UI/UX mockups and/or Usability Test if required to Contest Owner by this date. Once the Contest Owner approves the mockup, contestant who submitted that mockup will be selected to go to the next phase.
challengePrototypeTips: This date officially ends the Prototype phase of the contest. Contestants must submit their prototypes to Contest Owner by this date. Once the Contest Owner approves the prototype, contestant who submitted that prototype will be selected to go to the next phase.
